text: Jefferson Community College is a college in Watertown, New York. It offers two-year associate degrees. It is part of the State University of New York (SUNY) system. It was initially accredited in 1969, and is the only college in the State University of New York (SUNY) System with a zoo technology degree program. ==Campus== The campus consists of eight permanent buildings : * The Samuel Guthrie Building * The John Foster Dulles Building * The Gregor Building * The James McVean College Center Building * The Robert Lansing Administration Building * The John T. Henderson Child Care Center * The Jules R. Samann Instructional Resource Center (Often shortened to "The Jules Center") There are five instructional computer classrooms and one computer resource center. Jefferson offers a baseball diamond, soccer/lacrosse fields, lighted tennis and basketball courts, and a walking/running trail. ==References== Category:Colleges and universities in New York (state) Category:Two-year colleges in the United States Category:NJCAA schools
title: Jefferson Community College
